text: personally, I have always and still do hate the name `hfc` .  I don't think you actually have to preface the package name with `hyperledger` - that can be part of the description / etc which will be indexed for searching npm does not seem like it needs to be in the name of the package itself.   I don't think that the `fabric-` names are awesome, but they seem more clear to me so my vote would still be for `fabric-client` and `fabric-ca-client`  :wink:
ok, thanks <@U0PB67X4K> for voicing a strong preference, so i’m fine with that, and let’s settle on these names for the npm publish: `fabric-client` and `fabric-ca-client`
also, now that we are using a different package name, we can start with a lower version than 1.0.x. how about 0.1.0
